name: Marrakchi Tangia
ingredients: 1 head of garlic in its skin (unpeeled)
Salt (moderately, as the preserved lemon is salty)
steps: Cut the meat into pieces (if necessary).
In the earthenware jar (tangia) or a heavy cast iron pot/tajine, place the meat.
Add the spices (cumin, saffron), the rancid butter (smen), the olive oil, the garlic in its skin, and the preserved lemon cut into pieces.
Pour in the water. Mix well by shaking the pot.
Cover and seal tightly (traditionally with parchment paper and string, then sealed with a lid).
Cook over the embers of a traditional oven (farnatchi) or in the oven at very low temperature (120-150Â°C) for at least 3 hours, or until the meat is very tender and the sauce is reduced and creamy.
Serve hot with Moroccan bread (khobz or batbout).
